alert.note: Alert for Harney County; Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 2:43AM PST until January 05 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /10 AM PST/ THIS MORNING TO 5 AM MST /4 AM PST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. In the West Central Mountains, total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches, except 1 to 2 feet over the mountains, are expected. Winds will gust up to 35 mph this afternoon and evening. In the Camas Prairie, total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches are expected. Most of the accumulating snow will occur tonight, and again Tuesday night. In the Owyhee Mountains, total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches, except 5 to 15 inches over the mountains, are expected. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph this afternoon through tonight. In the Upper Weiser River, total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches are expected. In Harney County and Malheur County the snow will mix with or change to rain at times below 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, except up to a foot over the mountains, are expected. Winds will gust up to 55 mph this afternoon and evening. Most of the accumulating snow will occur tonight, and again Tuesday night. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Oregon and southwest and west central Idaho. * WHEN...From 11 AM MST /10 AM PST/ this morning to 5 AM MST /4 AM PST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Areas of blowing and drifting snow may result in continuously covered roads through this evening, and snow will blow back on to the roads very soon after they are plowed.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
